songs.full_title: On the Freeway by Bizzy Bone (Ft. Cat Cody)
songs.title: On the Freeway

description.plain:
This song is about a male and his female friend, who decide to go out and have some fun on a Friday night and “get away from it all”. It is unclear if they actually do “make love on the freeway”.

The male is seemingly teased and tempted by some actions of the female, and it is apparent by his reactions that he is enjoying her attention, but would prefer to take it slow instead of going forward.

He’s a bit conflicted, it sounds in some lines as if he likes her, and in the end, seems like he pushes her away and goes back to being on his own.

songs.full_title: Demons Surround Me by Bizzy Bone
songs.title: Demons Surround Me

description.plain: Bizzy Bone had a difficult childhood and adolescence and these experiences surround him like demons. Needing someone to talk to, he dials a psychic line which doesn’t seem to pick up for him. Despite this, Bizzy Bone demonstrates his insanity and darkness through rapid-fire raps with references to gangbanging and death.

songs.full_title: Murda Me by Bizzy Bone
songs.title: Murda Me

description.plain:
“Murda Me” is a diss towards Tomica Wright, Eazy-E wife and boss of a Ruthless records.

Bizzy penned this down after his debut album, “Heaven'z Movie”, which was released by Ruthless, wasn’t really completed. Bizzy said that Tomica didn’t do anything to get samples cleared for many songs, thus why records like “Life Goes On” (2Pac Tribute), “Trials & Tribulations”, “Walking In Da Cold”, “Way 2 Strong”, “Relentless”, “Retaliation”, “Power” and many more were omitted.

Moreover, Bizzy said in interviews that after release of the album, Tomica refused to pay him his money, but want to pay him with sex. That cannot be verified, but lyrics of this song suggest that it could be true.

“Heaven'z Movie” was his last album with Ruthless, and at that time he began feuding with his homies from Bone Thugs because of Tomica and label which resulted him being kicked out of a group for nearly 8 years.

Song wasn’t released on any album, it was leaked to the internet some time after it was recorded.
